chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas W. McCluskey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Douglas W. McCluskey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Douglas W. McCluskey was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO PIERCE CO CASE 14CM138

miscConds.notes: ALL COURT COSTS AND DNA SURCHARGE PAID IN FULL TO THE CLERK OF COURT

records.addlTxt: for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops  - FAXed to DOT on 12-19-14 @ 4:30 pm
Judge reviews plea waiver with defendant

9:10 am       TO INCLUDE 14CM138 AND COUNTY OF PIERCE CASES 14TR193, 194, 199, 451, 455 & 456 
Defendant Douglas W. McCluskey in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie: PLEA AGREEMENT - 14TR194 OWI - plead guilty   14TR193 and 14TR199 both dismissed.  RE:  14CM138 plead guilty to Ct 3 resist officer  Cts 1,2 & 4 dismissed.  Prob 2 years   RE: 14CF94 plead guilty to Ct 2 and dismiss Ct 1 - OWI citation 14TR456 - plea to that as well.  **This will now be an OWI 2nd.**  Guidelines are recommended.  No opposition to downward departure.    OWI 1st - dismiss refusal - guidelines: $1000.50, 9 month rev, alc assmt and dr safety plan, IID     OWI 2nd   pbt of .155     fine $1505, 20 days jail, 14 month rev, alc assmt and dr safety plan, IID - 1 year and 1 year revocation to run concurrent.  Thorie: 14CF94 Officer's eyeglasses rest: TBD 30 days.  Probation on 14CF94 and 14CM138    s/w probation 2 years, including costs and DNA surcharge.  14TR451 dismissed, 14TR455 dismissed.  Loberg agrees.  Def agrees.   Court:  14TR194 - def pleads guilty    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty.  Dismiss 14TR193 and 14TR199.  Loberg makes sentencing argument.  $1000.50 fine, 8 month rev; Court feels that they will run concurrent and be lesser.  Asks for 6 months to pay on this case and the 2nd OWI case.  He asks for community service option.  Court will allow.  

Court orders:  14TR194 - OWI 1st:  fine: $1000.50, 9 month rev, alc assmt and dr safety plan, IID for 1 year, $50 IID surcharge 

RE:  14CF94 and 14CM138 and 14TR456 (which is now a 2nd offense OWI criminal case).  Court reviews the plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court reviews the charges with the defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Court explains probation option and possible revocation of probation.  Def is not a vet.  RE: 14CM138 - def pleads guilty   Loberg stips to facts.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 3 of 14CM138, dismiss, Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 4.  RE: 14CF94  Def pleads guilty to Ct 2 resist/obstruct  Loberg stips to facts.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 2 and dismisses Ct 1 of this case.  RE: 14TR456 - now an OWI 2nd offense  Def pleads guilty to OWI 2nd offense from 06-16-2014.  Loberg stips to the facts.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of OWI 2nd offense.  Court dismisses 14TR451 and 14TR455 are both dismissed.  Loberg makes sentencing argument.  Report date of 11-28-14.  
COURT ORDERS: 
14CM138  s/w probation 2 years   Conditions: set forth by agent, court costs,  $243 and $200 DNA surcharge
14CF94: s/w probation 2 years concurrent.   Conditions set for by the agent,  $243 and $200 DNA surcharge 
14TR    : OWI 2nd     Fine: $1379, 15 days jail, 12 month rev concurrent, alc assmt and dr safety plan, IID for 1 year, $50 IID surcharge 
1 day credit for time served, Huber granted, report on 7 pm on 11-28-2014;  6 months to pay all fines
Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on November 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Def pleas not guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2. Court enters in not guilty pleas. Thorie requests a change to bond.  Defendant is getting treatment at St Joseph's Hosptial in St Paul MN during the week. Court goes over the bond conditions with Def.

2:05 Defendant Douglas W. McCluskey in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CM138, 14TR138, 194, 199, 451, 455, 456. Court goes over Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver Form.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def waives his right to have a preliminary hearing.  Court approves and accepts the waiver. Finds the Def probably committed a felony and binds the Def over for trial. Thorie files information; Def has a copy. Court reads the charges and maximum penalties. Def waives further reading.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
to Continuance filed by William Thorie
